column2: PENNSYLVANIA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.

column2: 2. Never make a U-turn from:
column8: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 3. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: there is a school zone after the curve.
column8: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column10: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.

column2: 4. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column10: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 5. Drivers entering a traffic circle:
column4: have the right of way if there are two or more lanes.
column6: must stop before entering the traffic circle.
column8: must yield to drivers in the traffic circle.

column2: 6. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
7. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 8. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
9. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 10. You may honk your horn when you:
column6: have lost control of your car.

column2: 11. Roads freeze more quickly when they are:
12. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
13. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 14. An average person needs ___ minutes to process the alcohol in one drink.
15. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column6: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 16. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 17. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column10: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 18. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
